Subject: Weekly State of the Market - China (2025-11-01)

China Manufacturing Index

Executive Summary

The latest China Manufacturing Purchasing Managersâ€™ Index (PMI) data for October 2025 indicates a continued contraction in manufacturing activity, registering at 49.0. This marks a consistently bearish trend throughout most of 2025, with the PMI remaining below the 50-point expansion threshold in most months, notably reaching 49.0 in April and October 2025. Occasional slight expansions were observed in March (50.5) and February (50.2) of 2025. Overall market sentiment for the manufacturing sector is moderately bearish.

Key sub-indices reinforce this sentiment: the new order index has consistently remained below 50 (e.g., 46.0 in September 2025, 46.6 in August 2025), signaling weak demand. Employment figures also consistently show contraction (e.g., 45.0 in September 2025), indicating job shedding. While production has frequently hovered above 50, sustained weakness in new orders and employment suggests future output challenges.

For Industrial Metals, the persistent contraction in the raw material inventory index (e.g., 48.0 in August 2025) coupled with declining new orders points to reduced demand from manufacturers. This presents a downside risk for industrial metal prices and consumption. China equities face headwinds from this contractionary manufacturing environment; the subdued demand and employment trends imply pressure on corporate earnings and broader economic growth, suggesting a moderately bearish outlook, particularly for industrially-exposed sectors.
